# My answer
n, m = map(int, input().split())

likes = []
for i in range(n):
    likes.append(list(map(int, input().split()))[1:])

# print(likes)

foods = []
for i in range(m):
    foods.append(i+1)

# print(foods)

for i in range(n):
    foods = list(set(foods) & set(likes[i]))

print(len(foods))

# Reference answer
n, m = map(int, input().split())

likes = []
for i in range(n):
    likes.append(list(map(int, input().split()))[1:])

foods = []
for i in range(m):
    foods.append(i+1)

for i in range(n):
    foods = list(set(foods) & set(likes[i]))

print(len(foods))
